results.title: Waverley steps: a visit to Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: John Eldridge, Paul Fletcher and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: A description of Edinburgh, past and present. The film attempts more to convey the atmosphere of the city than to give a straight description of its outstanding features.

results.title: Wave velocities, dispersion and the omega beta diagram (TEFC
results.brief_description: Theodore Van Duger of the University of California, Berkley, shows that a prediction of the action of complex waves can be determined if it is known how its sine wave components propagate along the same system. The film studies the propagation and superposition of complex waves in a barrier system.

results.title: Wave particle duality
results.brief_description: Introduces and discusses the dual nature of light and matter and traces the development of the theory of wave-particle duality. A demonstration showing beams of electrons and neutrons creating a picture of wave motion similar to light’s wave motion is also given.

results.title: Wattle ballad. No. 1. My old black billy
results.brief_description: The song of the swagman who intends to “stick to me sensible, indispensable, old black billy”, sung by male voices and illustrated by shots of the swagman’s life. Arranged and sung by The Ramblers. Cast features Jock Levy.

results.title: Waters of life
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: The advantages of the Colombo Plan to the people of Ceylon. Shows how the old way of living, with its drought, disease and lack of agriculture has been changed by the new schemes providing for controlled irrigation, clearing of land, and resettling of villages. Adapted from the Ceylon Government Film “New Horizons”.

results.title: Waterloo farmers
results.creator_credit: Italo Costa, Gary Toole, Roman Bittman and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film juxtaposes Old Order Mennonites and New Order Mennonites. Their differing beliefs are reflected in their methods of farming. One has not changed in four hundred years; the other is up-to-date and mechanized. The film asks whether a compromise will eventually have to be reached between the two.

results.title: Waterloo
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Set in Waterloo, an inner city suburb of Sydney, this film describes the bitter and drawn out struggle of a group of residents to save their suburb from slum clearance and redevelopment by state housing authorities. Making extensive use of newsreels, stills and re-enactment, “Waterloo” examines the struggle in the context of the history of Sydney’s inner city suburbs from the anti eviction campaigns of the 1930s to the rise of the resident action movement of the late 1960s. This film shows how squatting and trade union intervention eventually succeeded in forcing the government to recognise the right of the ordinary people to participate in planning decisions affecting the future of their communities. Four months after this film was first publicly screened in 1981, the residents of Waterloo won their battle. The film played a major part in that victory.

results.title: Waterlily
results.creator_credit: Katie Wright, Chris McGill and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: It is Lily’s 15th birthday and she is faced with spending the day with her ridiculous and unbearable family. Until her party she escapes into her dreams of “football star”, Tony Young - the latest object of her romantic imagination. At the same time Old Hob, a permanent resident in the family hotel, is set upon finding the ‘big stream’, enlisting a skateboarding gang to form a team of water diviners which includes Jeff, who has a crush on Lily. At the climax of her day circumstances go embarrassingly and disastrously awry as Lily is trying to deal with her family and her hopeful yet unrequited love for Tony. Yet, with the help of a little magic, even under the reign of absolute chaos, something might just turn out alright for Lily.
